structure.unit: Regulation Of Take Over Bids In The Acquisition Of Corporations

text.section: The offeror or the target company is a public utility or a public utility holding company as defined in section two of the “Public Utility Holding Company Act of 1935”, 15 U.S.C. 79, as amended, and the take-over bid is subject to approval by the appropriate federal agency as provided in such act;

The offeror or the target company is a bank or a bank holding company subject to the “Bank Holding Company Act of 1956”, 12 U.S.C. 1841, as amended, and the take-over bid is subject to approval by the appropriate federal agency as provided in such act;

The offeror or the target company is a savings and loan holding company as defined in section two of the “Savings and Loan Holding Company Amendments of 1967”, 12 U.S.C. 1730A, as amended, and the take-over bid is subject to approval by the appropriate federal agency as provided in such act;
The offeror and the target company are banks and the offer is part of a merger transaction subject to approval by appropriate federal supervisory authorities.
